business.headline: Dubai's billionaire realty map: Can India's salaried class invest there?For years, Dubai's skyline has glittered like a dream, much like that tempting NRI cousin who always seemed a step ahead in life. But things are changing as salaried Indians are looking to venture into Dubai's posh real estate.
Sensex closes 123 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; HCLTech gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 123.42 points to end at 82,515.14, while the NSE Nifty gained 37.15 points to close at 25,141.40.

Bharat rising: Why Tier-2 cities drive job growth, explains HireVeda co-founderWhile the metros still lead in the number of jobs, the speed of growth in smaller cities is hard to ignore, noted co-founder of HireVeda and ExecEdge.

India now home to over 85,000 millionaires, ranks 4th globally: ReportIndia now trails only the United States, China, and Japan in terms of the number of wealthy individuals, accounting for 3.7% of the global HNWI population.

Digital Form 16: Step-by-step guide to download and use it for easy ITR filingWith the advent of digital platforms, accessing and using Form 16 has become more straightforward, making it a vital document for accurate and hassle-free income tax return (ITR) filing.

Chasing Rs 10 discounts? CA explains why tracking every rupee isn't making you richIt's a common belief that managing every rupee wisely equals financial discipline. People cut back on little indulgences and chase discounts, feeling financially in control, yet, their money may be slipping away in unnoticed ways.

'Make in India' gave us breakthrough in defence, says Bharat Forge's Baba Kalyani"A lot of army guys walked by, some laughed at it," Chairman Baba Kalyani said during an episode of the New India Junction podcast  "Not a single guy stopped to even see what the hell it was."

Paramount to cut 3.5% of US jobs as cable TV declines: ReportThis is not the first round of job losses at Paramount. Back in August last year, the company had already cut 15% of its workforce, indicating ongoing adjustments in response to market changes.

Law tribunal clears merger of Inox Wind Energy Limited with Inox WindThe merger is expected to reduce liabilities by around Rs 2,050 crore. The company also expects to save costs by improving how resources are used and by simplifying various processes.
Sensex opens 86 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; RIL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 104.24 points to 82,495.96, while the NSE Nifty50 added 36.70 points to 25,140.95 as of 9:31 am.

Oswal Pumps IPO to open soon with Rs 1,387 crore target. Check detailsOswal Pumps is launching an IPO aiming to raise Rs 1,387.34 crore. Here are essential details potential investors need to consider before subscribing.

Tariff cuts, easing digital barriers: India, US make headway in trade talksBoth nations are aiming for an interim trade pact by the end of June, before the pause on Trump's proposed tariffs expires. India is advocating for full exemption from a 26% reciprocal tariff on domestic goods.

entertainment.headline: Who is Milind Chandwani, actor Avika Gor's soon-to-be husband?Actor Avika Gor recently got engaged to 'MTV Roadies Real Heroes' fame Milind Chandwani. Chandwani is an IIM-Ahmedabad graduate and currently runs an NGO dedicated to underprivileged children.

Aamir Khan opens up about height insecurities, recalls support from Javed AkhtarAamir Khan, known as the perfectionist of Hindi cinema, recently spoke about his early career insecurities regarding his height. He credited humour and advice from Javed Akhtar for helping him overcome these fears.

Pawan Kalyan back on Ustaad Bhagat Singh sets, makers release video After wrapping up 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' and 'OG', actor and Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan has now resumed work on 'Ustaad Bhagat Singh'. A behind-the-scenes video shared by the makers shows him arriving on set, interacting with the team.

Rupali Ganguly reacts with pride after PM Modi talks menstrual hygieneRupali Ganguly has expressed her admiration for PM Narendra Modi's efforts in breaking menstrual taboos. She feels proud of the positive impact this initiative has on society and awareness.

Mark Ruffalo dedicates poetic anniversary post to wife: My love, partner and friendActor Mark Ruffalo recently wrote a romantic note for his wife Sunrise Coigney on social media. He shared a series of pictures with Sunrise, while cherishing their 25th wedding anniversary.

We have to be feared: Goldy Brar justifies shooting at AP Dhillon's Canada homeGangster Goldy Brar reacted to the 2024 shooting outside singer AP Dhillon's Canada residence. In a documentary, Brar justified the incident, and said thousands of families are dependent on his gang.

Avika Gor engaged to boyfriend Milind Chandwani in filmy, magical ceremonyActor Avika Gor has announced her engagement to 'MTV Roadies Real Heroes' fame Milind Chandwani through Instagram. The couple has been together for over five years.

Sidhu Moose Wala's 3 unreleased songs out on his birth anniversary, go viralThree new tracks by the late Punjabi rapper Sidhu Moose Wala went viral within hours of its release on YouTube and Spotify. The tracks were released to mark his birth anniversary on June 11.

BTS V back on Instagram after military discharge, shares throwback picsA day after being discharged from mandatory military service, BTS' V treated his fans with a bunch of throwback pictures from his time. BTS' RM, Jungkook, V and Jimin were officially discharged from the services.

Blake Lively slams manufactured shame against women after Baldoni lawsuit dismissalActor Blake Lively recently highlighted the manufactured shame and emotional toll women have to endure after her win over Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuit against her.

Jr NTR begins dubbing for 'War 2', his action film with Hrithik RoshanJr NTR has officially begun dubbing for his much-anticipated Bollywood film, 'War 2'. The film, which also stars Hrithik Roshan and Kiara Advani, is slated for release on August 14.

Actor Jason Isaacs reacts to Tom Felton's return as Draco in Broadway's Harry PotterActor Tom Felton is set to reprise his role as Draco Malfoy on Broadway starting November 11. Jason Isaacs, who played his on-screen father Lucius in the film franchise, reacted to his return in the Harry Potter play.

Parth Samthaan shares pics with CID 2 team as he bids farewell to the showActor Parth Samthaan shared a bunch of pictures from CID 2 set as he bid farewell to the show. He had replaced actor Shivaji Satam as ACP Ayushman.

Nandamuri Balakrishna's knife flip goes viral from his 65th birthday bashActor and MLA Nandamuri Balakrishna celebrated his 65th birthday on June 10 with massive fanfare across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. The actor warmly interacted with fans who gathered to celebrate his birthday, posing for selfies.

Panchayat 4 trailer reactions: Fans say life is good againFans gave a thumbs up to the trailer of 'Panchayat Season 4', which was released by the makers on June 11.  The social media users expressed their excitement and shared how they couldn't wait any longer for the series.

Kesari Chapter 2 on OTT: When and where to watch Akshay Kumar's courtroom dramaAkshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2' is set to stream on Jio Hotstar from June 13. The film also stars R Madhavan and Ananya Panday in key roles.

Housefull 5 turns animal cruelty into comedy, and it's uglyIn 'Housefull 5', a digitally-created parrot is relentlessly thrashed and beaten for cheap laughs. But when did beating a parrot become a joke? When did we decide that it was funny?

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2 to premiere on July 3: Reports'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi 2' will reportedly premiere on July 3. The show's first episode aired on the same day 25 years ago. Ekta Kapoor's father Jeetendra is also likely to make an appearance in the sequel.

Rahul Vaidya says Virat Kohli's brother called him after Instagram controversySinger Rahul Vaidya shared that Virat Kohli's brother, Vikas Kohli, contacted him after his controversial remarks involving the cricketer. Vikas advised Rahul to focus on his singing instead of seeking publicity through Virat's name.

general news.headline: Rare minerals to us, college admissions to them: Trump's done deal with ChinaWith this deal, Beijing will supply magnets and rare earth minerals to the US while the latter will allow Chinese students in its colleges and universities.

Phenomenal counter-terrorism partner: US general's big backing for PakistanTestifying before the House Armed Services Committee on Tuesday, General Kurilla strongly advocated for maintaining strategic ties with both India and Pakistan, asserting that the US must not view its South Asia policy through a zero-sum lens.

Sonam admits to plotting honeymoon murder, breaks down before cops: SourcesSonam Raghuvanshi confessed to hatching a plan to get her husband killed with the help of her alleged lover Raj Kushwaha, who, too, confessed to the crime a day before.

Row over filthy train sent for BSF jawans on Amarnath duty; 4 officials suspendedThe train provided to BSF jawans for their travel to Amarnath Yatra was in a dirty, dilapidated condition. The incident sparked outrage, following which four railway officials were suspended.

Murder, matrimony, and melodrama: A honeymoon in Meghalaya ends in horrorA couple's honeymoon in Meghalaya turns into a chilling murder tale involving a suspected love triangle, a viral influencer sister, and a public outcry for justice wrapped in online melodrama.

WTC Final 2025 Day 1: Australian pacers rattle South Africa at Lord'sAustralia vs South Africa Live Score, World Test Championship Final 2025 Updates: Australian pace trio of Mitchell Starc, Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood rattled South Africa with four quick wickets in the final session of Day 1. Earlier in the day, Kagiso Rabada's five-wicket haul saw Australia bowled out for 212.

Srinagar girl rushed to hospital after thrashing by teachers at schoolDenying the girl's parents' allegations, the school said that she had a headache for which she was given medication, but her parents accused the school of wrongdoing.

Moose Wala made unforgivable mistakes: Goldy Brar on hip-hop star's murder In an interview with the BBC World Service, gangster Goldy Brar justified the killing, saying Moose Wala had committed "unforgivable" mistakes.

Can relationships be taught as a curriculum in a classroom?Delhi University (DU) has launched a course that will cover everything from understanding love and friendships to spotting red flags and building healthier bonds. The question is: Can relationships be taught as a curriculum in a classroom?

100% sure she did it: Sonam's brother blames her for Meghalaya honeymoon murderSonam's brother, who spoke to reporters in Indore after meeting Raja's mother, said while she hasn't confessed to the murder, the evidence that has emerged so far points to her direct involvement.

Indian student handcuffed, pinned down at airport had entered US illegallyAn Indian man from Haryana, who entered the US illegally, was being deported when he was restrained at Newark Airport due to unfit behaviour for travel, the official sources said.

It'll come back to haunt you: S Jaishankar warns West over Pak-backed terrorExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar addressed the global response to the recent Pahalgam terror attack in Kashmir and said terrorism will come back to haunt the West.
Why can some students memorise anything? Science has the answerRote memory isn't a gift, it's a brain game and not everyone is wired the same way. Science is here to tell you why.

Blood on sindoor: Why Indian marriages are turning deadlyFrom Sonam Raghuvanshi in Indore to Muskan of Meerut, a trail of women who allegedly killed their husbands casts a harsh light on contemporary Indian marriage and domestic life

Zohran Mamdani turns New York City mayoral race into Bollywood blockbusterZohran Mamdani has leaned into his South Asian heritage and captured the attention of younger, immigrant, and working-class New Yorkers with his populist platform and savvy use of Hindi film nostalgia.

Video: Have mercy, mother appeals to another on live TV in honeymoon murder caseAs the Meghalaya honeymoon murder probe deepens, an emotional face-off unfolded on India Today between the mothers of the accused and the victim, laying personal grief, blame, and a demand for justice.
What happens when you cut sugar from your diet for 30 daysCan a 30-day sugar break improve physical and mental health? Here's what experts say.

Visual story: How Meghalaya honeymoon murder unfoldedWith each passing day, new information related to the case comes into the public eye, and sometimes it contradicts what was previously known about the chilling case.

Pakistan scales up defence budget, but who is really fuelling it?Pakistan, in its FY2026 Budget, has increased defence expenditure by 20%, the largest hike in decades. This comes after setbacks from Indian strikes during Operation Sindoor and the shelving of projects worth PKR 1,000 billion. But with limited foreign exchange reserves and massive debt, how is Pakistan funding its military, and who is backing it?

Parde mein rehne do: Pakistan's cover-up operation after Sindoor strikesFresh high-resolution satellite images analysed by India Today show Pakistan is now using tarpaulins to cover at least three military sites hit during India's Operation Sindoor.

Trump can't broker peace between his ego and reality, forget about India-Pak ceasefireFrom his trade war dud against China to burning his fingers in the Ukraine-Russia war to his fake claims of brokering India-Pak ceasefire to stoking fire in Los Angeles, it's a global Donald Trump clown show in the White House. And we are running out of patience and popcorn.

Panchayat 4 trailer reactions: Fans say life is good againFans gave a thumbs up to the trailer of 'Panchayat Season 4', which was released by the makers on June 11.  The social media users expressed their excitement and shared how they couldn't wait any longer for the series.

Don't even drink Royal Challenge: DK Shivakumar denies rumours of buying RCBKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has denied rumours of buying the RCB franchise, saying he has no time for it. His clarification comes after 11 people died in a stampede at an RCB event. Shivakumar even joked, "I don't even drink Royal Challenge."

Watch: Lalu Yadav cuts humongous cake of laddoos with sword on 78th birthdayFormer Bihar Chief Minister and Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) president Lalu Prasad Yadav turned 78 on Wednesday. He made the occasion a special one by cutting a 78-kg cake made of laddoos at his Patna residence.

sports.headline: BCCI to discuss formulation of norms for IPL celebration after Bengaluru stampedeThe Indian cricket board will discuss the need to formulate norms for victory celebration of Indian Premier League franchises during its apex council meeting on June 14. The matter has gained urgency following the stampede in Bengaluru that killed 11 people and left over 50 injured.

Jasprit Bumrah's energy mind-blowing, in great shape for England Tests: MorkelIndia bowling coach Morne Morkel has praised pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah's rhythm and intensity during training sessions in England. The Indian team management plans to manage Bumrah's workload carefully due to his back injury history, aiming for peak fitness in the upcoming Test series.

Sad Virat Kohli retired like this, I'd have made him Test captain again: ShastriFormer India captain Ravi Shastri said Virat Kohli's sudden retirement from Test cricket could have been handled better by the stakeholders of Indian cricket. Kohli ended his Test career on May 12, a month before India's tour of England.

Five-star Kagiso Rabada goes past Allan Donald, rattles Australia at Lord'sWorld Test Championship 2025 final: South Africa fast bowler Kagiso Rabada took a five-wicket haul as Australia were bundled out for 212 on Day 1 of the big final. Rabada was well supported by left-arm pacer Marco Jansen at Lord's, London.

Mumbai Indians star Tilak Varma to get red-ball exposure in County ChampionshipTilak Varma will play in England's County Championship for Hampshire this summer. The Mumbai Indians star will reportedly play four first-class games in England.

WTC Final: Steve Smith goes past Gary Sobers to script Test record at Lord'sSteve Smith became the visiting batter to score the most runs in Tests at Lord's on Wednesday when he reached 51 runs on Day 1 of the World Test Championship final against South Africa.

Video: Kyle Verreynne takes stunning one-handed catch to dismiss Travis HeadSouth Africa dominated the morning session of the World Test Championship final against Australia at Lord's. Wicketkeeper Kyle Verreynne took a sensational catch to deny Travis Head a counterpunch on Day 1 in London.

Suryakumar Yadav drops to sixth, Adil Rashid roars to no. 2India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav has slipped out of the top five in the latest ICC Men's T20I Rankings for batters. On the other hand, England leg-spinner Adil Rashid has climbed to No. 2 in the bowling rankings.

Watch: D Gukesh picks his favourite meme on viral Magnus Carles outburstD Gukesh couldn't stop laughing as he reacted to hilarious viral memes about Magnus Carlsen's dramatic table slam — even picking his personal favourites in a ChessBase India interview that delighted fans online.

How to manage Bumrah's workload in England? Ganguly gives key adviceSourav Ganguly warned the Indian team from overworking Jasprit Bumrah and advised them to limit his workload during the England tour. Bumrah carried the bulk of the load during the Australia tour, which forced him out of action due to a back issue.

ICC Chairman Jay Shah rings Lord's bell to kick off ultimate Test battleICC chairman Jay Shah rang the iconic Lord's bell to mark the start of the World Test Championship final. South Africa seized early advantage, bowling first, putting Australia under pressure on day one.

Video: Kyle Verreynne takes stunning one-handed catch to dismiss Travis HeadSouth Africa dominated the morning session of the World Test Championship final against Australia at Lord's. Wicketkeeper Kyle Verreynne took a sensational catch to deny Travis Head a counterpunch on Day 1 in London.

Suryakumar Yadav drops to sixth, Adil Rashid roars to no. 2India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav has slipped out of the top five in the latest ICC Men's T20I Rankings for batters. On the other hand, England leg-spinner Adil Rashid has climbed to No. 2 in the bowling rankings.

Watch: D Gukesh picks his favourite meme on viral Magnus Carles outburstD Gukesh couldn't stop laughing as he reacted to hilarious viral memes about Magnus Carlsen's dramatic table slam — even picking his personal favourites in a ChessBase India interview that delighted fans online.

How to manage Bumrah's workload in England? Ganguly gives key adviceSourav Ganguly warned the Indian team from overworking Jasprit Bumrah and advised them to limit his workload during the England tour. Bumrah carried the bulk of the load during the Australia tour, which forced him out of action due to a back issue.

ICC Chairman Jay Shah rings Lord's bell to kick off ultimate Test battleICC chairman Jay Shah rang the iconic Lord's bell to mark the start of the World Test Championship final. South Africa seized early advantage, bowling first, putting Australia under pressure on day one.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
